Lyrics: Esta é como Santa María guareceu un óme que éra tolleito do córpo e dos nembros, na sa eigreja en Salas.
Direct Translation: This is how Holy Mary cured in Her church in Salas a man who was cripped in his body and limbs.

Lyrics: Como póden per sas culpas | os ómes seer contreitos,
Direct Translation: As men may be paralyzed because of their misdeeds,
Poetic Translation: Just as by our own offenses We are broken and unfeeling,

Lyrics: assí póden pela Virgen | depois seer sãos feitos.
Direct Translation: so may they then be made whole by the Virgin.
Poetic Translation: We can be restored to wholeness By the Holy Virgin's healing.

Lyrics: Ond' avẽo a un óme, | por pecados que fezéra,
Direct Translation: It happened that a man, because of sins he had committed,
Poetic Translation: For there lived a man whose sinning Was so terrible and shocking

Lyrics: que foi tolleito dos nembros | dũa door que ouvéra,
Direct Translation: was crippled in his limbs from an illness he had suffered.
Poetic Translation: That his arms and legs had frozen, Keeping him from even walking.

Lyrics: e durou assí cinc' anos | que mover-se non podéra,
Direct Translation: He remained thus for five years, unable to move,
Poetic Translation: For five years, he sat unmoving, All his joints and muscles locking,

Lyrics: assí avía os nembros | todos do córpo maltreitos.
Direct Translation: so badly twisted were all the members of his body.
Poetic Translation: Everyone raround him acting Like his face was unappealing.

Lyrics: Con esta enfermidade | atán grande que avía
Direct Translation: Because of this terrible infirmity that he had,
Poetic Translation: He grew tired of living badly And with always being sickly,

Lyrics: prometeu que, se guarisse, | a Salas lógo iría
Direct Translation: he promised that if he got well, he would go to Salas at once
Poetic Translation: And he swore if he got better, He would go to Salas quickly,

Lyrics: e ũa livra de cera | cad' ano ll' oferería;
Direct Translation: and would offer Holy Mary a libra of wax each year.
Poetic Translation: Taking as an offering there The best beeswax he could pick. He

Lyrics: e atán tóste foi são, | que non ouv' i outros preitos.
Direct Translation: He got well immediately and had no further complaints.
Poetic Translation: Was at once completely cured and Went outside, his health revealing.

Lyrics: E foi-se lógo a Salas, | que sól non tardou nïente,
Direct Translation: He went at once to Salas and did not delay
Poetic Translation: He, no longer slow in movement, Went to Salas to deliver

Lyrics: e levou sigo a livra | da cera de bõa mente;
Direct Translation: and took with him gladly the libra of wax.
Poetic Translation: All the beeswax he could carry, With the attitude of a giver.

Lyrics: e ía mui lédo, como | quen se sen nïún mal sente,
Direct Translation: He went along nimbly as one who feels no pain,
Poetic Translation: And he went along so nimbly, Like no pain had made him shiver,

Lyrics: pero tan gran temp' ouvéra | os pés d' andar desafeitos.
Direct Translation: notwithstanding that his feet had been unaccustomed to walking for a long time.
Poetic Translation: Like his feet were used to walking And no stones could send him reeling.

Lyrics: Daquest' a Santa María | déron graças e loores,
Direct Translation: For this miracle they thanked and praised Holy Mary
Poetic Translation: Now unto the Holy Virgin We will offer thanks and praises,

Lyrics: porque livra os doentes | de maes e de doores
Direct Translation: because she frees the sick from suffering and pain,
Poetic Translation: For She heals when we're in pain, and All Her gracoiusness amazes.

Lyrics: e demais está rogando | sempre por nós pecadores;
Direct Translation: and furthermore, She is always praying for us sinners,
Poetic Translation: When we ask, She always answers And us lowly sinners raises,

Lyrics: e porên devemos todos | sempre seer séus sogeitos.
Direct Translation: hence we should all forever be Her loyal subjects.
Poetic Translation: And we owe Her everything, so We are worshiping and kneeling.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
Direct Translation: Alfonso. Songs of Holy Mary of Alfonso X, the Wise: A Translation of the Cantigas de Santa Maria. Trans. Kathleen Kulp-Hill. Tempe, AZ: Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies, 2000. Print.
